title: AdaGReS:Adaptive Greedy Context Selection via Redundancy-Aware Scoring for Token-Budgeted RAG
summary: AdaGReS introduces a novel redundancy-aware framework for token-budgeted Retrieval-augmented Generation (RAG) that optimizes context selection by balancing query-chunk relevance with intra-set redundancy penalties. It employs greedy selection with an adaptively calibrated trade-off parameter, providing theoretical guarantees and significantly improving context quality, answer accuracy, and robustness, particularly for high-redundancy biomedical information.

title: Computational Analysis of Disease Progression in Pediatric Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension
summary: This study developed and calibrated multi-scale, patient-specific computational cardiovascular models for four pediatric Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension (PAH) patients using longitudinal MRI and catheterization data. The models successfully captured patient-specific hemodynamic adaptation over two years, with derived metrics aligning well with clinical indicators of disease severity and progression. This work demonstrates the potential of computational modeling as a non-invasive tool for monitoring pediatric PAH and informing future treatment strategies.

title: MAMA-Memeia! Multi-Aspect Multi-Agent Collaboration for Depressive Symptoms Identification in Memes
summary: This paper addresses the identification of depressive symptoms expressed through memes on social media platforms, a growing medium for emotional expression. It introduces RESTOREx, a vital resource for meme-based depression detection leveraging LLM-generated and human-annotated explanations. The core contribution is MAMAMemeia, a collaborative multi-agent multi-aspect discussion framework grounded in Cognitive Analytic Therapy (CAT) Competencies, which significantly improves macro-F1 performance by 7.55% over state-of-the-art methods, establishing a new benchmark.

title: A Proof-of-Concept for Explainable Disease Diagnosis Using Large Language Models and Answer Set Programming
summary: This paper introduces McCoy, a novel proof-of-concept framework that addresses the challenge of creating high-quality knowledge bases for symbolic AI in healthcare by integrating Large Language Models (LLMs) with Answer Set Programming (ASP). McCoy leverages LLMs to translate medical literature into ASP code, combines it with patient data, and uses an ASP solver to produce robust and interpretable disease diagnoses. Preliminary results indicate strong performance on small-scale diagnostic tasks, demonstrating the potential for explainable AI in medicine.

title: Learning to learn skill assessment for fetal ultrasound scanning
summary: This paper introduces a novel bi-level optimization framework for automated and objective fetal ultrasound skill assessment, addressing the subjectivity and time-intensity of traditional methods. It assesses skills by quantifying how well a clinical task is performed on acquired ultrasound images, utilizing jointly optimized clinical task and skill predictor networks without relying on manually predefined skill ratings. Validation on real-world fetal head scan videos demonstrates the framework's feasibility in predicting and indicating ultrasound skills through optimized task performance.

title: StressRoBERTa: Cross-Condition Transfer Learning from Depression, Anxiety, and PTSD to Stress Detection
summary: StressRoBERTa is a novel cross-condition transfer learning approach for the automatic detection of self-reported chronic stress in English tweets. By continually training a RoBERTa model on data from conditions highly comorbid with stress (depression, anxiety, PTSD), it achieved an 82% F1-score, outperforming the best prior system by 3 percentage points and demonstrating superior performance compared to general mental health models.

title: Zero-Trust Agentic Federated Learning for Secure IIoT Defense Systems
